page.title: 11MR.CRASKE REMEMBERS.
page.content: {Mr.Stanley Craske}came to school to talk to us and answer our questions because he is a very keen{amateur {local historian.}He was born in 1913 and came to our school when he was three. He left when he was fourteen. He told us about the teachers, mainly {Mr.Day,the Headmaster,}who died in 1981. When Mr.Craske left school he went to work in the office of the old {Erpingham District Council.} He eventually married and had one son who is a teacher in Essex. Mr.Craske has been a widower for some years. He remembers Sheringham as a town of two styles, in summer a popular seaside resort, in winter a "family" town where most of the residents knew each other and most were related by marriage. Change has occurred slowly but employment locally has diminished and most young people leave town.
